thread.title: The X-Files - 'What If' Promo And New Promotional Poster
thread.title_full: The X-Files - 'What If' Promo And New Promotional Poster

title: The X-Files - 'What If' Promo And New Promotional Poster
text: The X-Files - 'What If' Promo And New Promotional Poster Reported by Outsiders - 2015.10.20 FOX has just released another 30-second promo spot for their upcoming revival of the fan-favorite sci-fi series "The X-Files," featuring the return of Fox Mulder (David Duchovny) and Dana Scully (Gillian Anderson). The commercial, which aired during Gotham, has some glimpses of new footage from the limited 6-episode series which will also feature the return of Walter Skinner (Mitch Pileggi) and the mysterious Cigarette Smoking Man (William B. Davis), who also just recently received a new character poster. "X-Files" creator Chris Carter is writing and directing the opening and closing episodes, while former "X-Files" producers Glen Morgan, Darin Morgan, and James Wong are handling the rest of the four episodes. The limited series is set to begin with a two-night premiere starting on Sunday, January 24, 2016, following the NFC Championship Game. Thirteen years after the original series run, the next mind-bending chapter of THE X-FILES will be a thrilling, six-episode event series helmed by creator/executive producer Chris Carter, with stars David Duchovny and Gillian Anderson re-inhabiting their roles as iconic FBI Agents FOX MULDER and DANA SCULLY. This marks the momentous return of the Emmy- and Golden Globe Award-winning pop culture phenomenon, which remains one of the longest-running sci-fi series in network television history. Production on THE X-FILES event series is set to begin in summer 2015. THE X-FILES originally premiered in September 1993. Over the course of its nine-season run, the influential series went from breakout sci-fi favorite to massive global hit, and became one of the most successful television dramas of all time. The show, which earned 16 Emmy Awards, five Golden Globes and a Peabody Award, follows FBI special agents Scully (Anderson) and Mulder (Duchovny), as they investigate unexplained cases -- "X-Files" -- for which the only answers involve paranormal phenomena.
